page.title: 04BIRDS OF PREY
page.content: In Strathnairn there are quite a lot of birds of prey.{There are the golden {eagle,buzzard,sparrowhawk,osprey, {peregrine falcon,kestrel,barn owl,long {eared owl and the short eared owl} nesting in our area. { {Golden Eagle The Golden Eagle eats grouse,hares, rabbits and is known to kill young deer. The female lays two eggs one white one and the other one has heavy brown blotches on it.There is a eyrie on the hill south east of the school. The Golden Eagle is now becoming rare because farmers spray chemicals on crops then little birds come along and eat the corn.The Golden Eagle and other birds of prey eat the birds then the poison builds up inside them and they die.We wish that it was possible to protect crops without harming birds
